did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Electronic bulletins, serial issues, pamphlets, other printed matter, sound recordings, and video tapes, relating to political aspects of Islam in the Middle East and elsewhere.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: Arabic Persian English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Islamic Fundamentalism Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection started with a three-year project, August 1995 to August 1998, to document Islamic fundamentalism around the world. The bulk of the material in boxes 1-19 represents collecting that occurred in the field and over the Internet during this period. Although this specific project formally ended in August 1998, collecting is ongoing and the collection continues to grow.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection relates to political aspects of Islam in the Middle East and elsewhere. It contains printouts of electronic bulletins and websites, serial issues, pamphlets, other printed matter, sound recordings, and video tapes. The materials are primarily in Arabic and Persian.

The collection started with a three-year project, August 1995 to August 1998, to document Islamic fundamentalism around the world. The bulk of the material in boxes 1-19 represents collecting that occurred in the field and over the Internet during this period. Although this specific project formally ended in August 1998, collecting is ongoing and the collection continues to grow.
Lists of sound recordings and videorecordings in this collection may be found in boxes 104-105.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Consists of user note, inventory, and database printout prepared by Hoover Institution staff. The user note describes the three-year project (August 1995 - August 1998) to collect the materials in boxes 1-19. The database printout provides contact information and descriptive notes for circa eighty Islamic entities
